questions.question: What is the definition of ergonomics?

options.A: Fitting the job to the worker
options.C: Process of improving industrial safety standards
options.D: Prevention of health problems of factory workers

questions.question: Who is the Chairman of ESI corporation in India?

options.B: Union Minister of Health & Family Welfare
options.D: Union Minister of Human Resources Development

questions.explanation: The Union Minister of Labour is the Chairman of the Employees' State Insurance Corporation(ESIC) in India.The Secretary to the Ministry of Labour is the Vice-Chairman of ESIC.

questions.question: You are working as a medical officer in a factory. You are expected to notify all of thefollowing occupational diseases, under the Factories Act, except:
questions.explanation: Bagassosis is not a notifiable disease, under the Factories Act.

questions.question: According to the Factories Act 1948, what is the maximum work hours per week includingovertime work hours?
questions.explanation: 706Maximum work hours per week including overtime work hours is 60 hours.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about the Factories Act?

options.A: Children under 14 years of age must not be employed in factories
options.B: A child of 16 years can be employed only between 6 AM and 8 PM
options.C: The maximum working hours for an adult is 72 hours per week
options.D: A child of 16 years can work till 5 hours per day

questions.explanation: The Factories Act prohibits children of less than 14 years from being employed. Children between 15-18 years can be employed only in certain industries and work only between 6 AM-7 PM. They should not be made to work for more than four and a half hours. The maximum working hours for an adult industrial worker should be no more than 48 hours per week, not exceeding 9 hours a day; if overtime is paid, then it should be no more than 60 hours per week.

questions.question: What is the maximum daily working hours for an adolescent employee, according to theFactories Act of 1948?
questions.explanation: According to the Factories Act of 1948, adolescents should not be made to work for more thanfour and a half hours a day.

questions.question: According to Factories Act of 1948, a welfare officer has to be employed if the number ofemployees is:
questions.explanation: A welfare officer has to be employed if the number of employees is > 500 according to theFactories Act of 1948.According to the Factories Act, safety and welfare measures include the provision of the following:•> 1000 employees - Safety Officer• > 500 employees - Welfare Officer•> 250 employees - Canteen• > 50 employees - Crèche

questions.question: Which of the following establishments is covered by the Employees' State Insurance Act?
questions.explanation: Currently, private medical and educational institutes employing >20 people are covered underthe ESI Act.The ESI Act is applicable to all industries except:• Defence•Railway• Mines707

questions.question: What percentage of the total wage bill is contributed by the employer under the ESI Act?
questions.explanation: The employer contributes 3.25% of the total wage bill under the ESI Act.The government has revised the rates of ESI contribution by employers (from 4.75% to 3.25%)and employees (from 1.75% to 0.75%) in 2019.The distribution of the financial contribution is given below:•Employee: 0.75% of the total wage bill••Employer: 3.25% of the total wage billMedical benefit: 1/8th by the state government and 7/8th by the central government

questions.question: Under the ESI Act, which of the following is not given as a cash benefit?
questions.explanation: Under the ESI Act, medical benefit is not given as a cash benefit. It is provided in the form of consultations, investigations, and treatment by means of the ESI hospitals or ESI dispensaries.

questions.question: What is enhanced sickness benefit?

options.A: Benefit given at 70% of the wage for 91 days
options.B: Benefit given at 80% of the wage for 120 days
options.C: Benefit given for a duration of 2 years for 34 specified diseases
options.D: Benefit given at full wages for undergoing sterilization procedure

questions.explanation: Enhanced sickness benefit under the ESI Act is the benefit given at full wages for undergoingsterilization procedures.Under the ESI Act, sickness benefit is given at 70% of the daily wage for a duration of 91 days inone year. There are two special types of sickness benefits given:• Enhanced sickness benefit: Benefit given at full wages for sterilization procedures; for a durationof 7 days post-vasectomy and 14 days post-tubectomy.• Extended sickness benefit: Benefit given for a duration of 2 years for 34 specified diseases.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a benefit given under the ESI Act?
questions.explanation: Welfare benefit is not given under the ESI act.The following benefits are given under the ESI act:•• Medical benefit• Sickness benefit• Maternity benefit• Dependance benefit• Disablement benefit• Funeral benefit• Rehabilitation benefit708

questions.question: An employee diagnosed with TB gets an extended sickness benefit for:
questions.explanation: Extended sickness benefit is given for a period of 2 years.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about ESI Act?

options.B: State government covers 1/8th and ESI corporation covers 7/8th of the cost of medical care
options.C: Maternity benefit is payable at full wages for upto 24 weeks
options.D: It covers all employees getting income up to Rs.18,000/- per month

questions.explanation: The state government's share of expenditure on medical care is 1/8th, and the ESI corporation'sshare of expenditure on medical care is 7/8th of the total cost.Few important points about the ESI Act:• It covers all employees getting income up to Rs.21,000/- per month.• The employer contributes 3.25% of the total wage bill.•An employee contributes 0.75% of wages.• State and Central government share medical expenditure in the ratio 1:7.•Medical benefit: Full medical care• Sickness benefit: 70% of the average daily wages and is payable for 91 days..Extended sickness benefit: Payable for 2 years for a set of 34 diseases.• Enhanced sickness benefit: Full average daily wage for a duration up to 7 days in case ofvasectomy and up to 14 days in case of tubectomy.• Maternity benefit: Full average daily wage for a duration up to 26 weeks (confinement) or 6weeks (miscarriage/MTP) or 4 weeks (sickness arising out of pregnancy).• Funeral expenses: Cash not exceeding Rs.15,000.

questions.question: Who is the beneficiary under the Rajiv Gandhi Shramik Kalyan Yojana scheme of ESI?

options.B: An insured person rendered unemployed, involuntarily
options.C: An insured employee who is pregnant

questions.explanation: Rajiv Gandhi Shramik Kalyan Yojana (RGSKY) is a scheme of ESI that benefits an insured personrendered unemployed, involuntarily.Unemployment allowance under RGSKY is given when an insured person is going out ofemployment involuntarily, on account of:• Closure of a factory or establishment• Retrenchment (laying off employees due to economic difficulty)•• Permanent disability due to nonemployment injuryAllowance and eligibility criteria of Rajiv Gandhi Shramik Kalyan Yojana (updated in 2019):••The allowance is given at the rate of 50% of the daily wage for a maximum of 2 years.To qualify for the scheme the worker must have worked in that setup for more than 3 years.709Note: Disability due to employment injury is covered under disablement benefits of ESI Act, 1948.•Temporary disability: 90% of wages until disablement lasts.•Permanent disability: 90% of wages as a life pension on the basis of loss of earning capacity.• Dependants benefit: 90% of wage as monthly payment to the dependants of the deceasedperson, in cases where death occurs due to employment injury or occupational hazards.710
